snippet: Mamoru Samuragochi, who had confessed that a ghostwriter wrote his best-known compositions, admitted that he had regained some of his hearing three years ago.
abstract: Mamoru Samuragochi, supposedly deaf Japanese musician whom some critics liken to modern day Beethoven, admits that his hearing loss was partly faked; statement follows earlier admission that a ghostwriter had written his best-known compositions.
lead_paragraph: Mamoru Samuragochi, who had confessed that a ghostwriter wrote his best-known compositions, admitted that he had regained some of his hearing three years ago.

headline.main: Japanese Composer Says His Hearing Loss Is Partly Faked
headline.print_headline: Hearing Loss Partly Faked, Composer Says
